rules: Rule1: Either the financial product has approval from the regulatory agency, or the financial product has generic competition.
Rule2: The financial product is sustainable, or either it is profitable or under the condition that the financial product has market demand, it generates revenue.
Rule3: Whenever the facility receives funding from the financial product, it has production capacity.
Rule4: If the financial product has an approved investment in the facility, then whenever the facility has production capacity, the facility is operational.
Rule5: Either the financial product has an approved investment in the facility, or the financial product has a rejected investment in the facility.
Rule6: Should the financial product have a rejected investment in the facility, then if the facility has production capacity, the facility is operational.

Rule7: If the facility has a license, then under the condition that it is not the case that if the facility has an investment in the financial product, then the financial product does not have approval from the regulatory agency, the facility violates regulations.
Rule8: Assuming the financial product has a recall, then the financial product does not have approval from the regulatory agency.
Rule9: Either the financial product has a recall, or the facility has an investment in the financial product.
Rule10: If the facility applied for renewal, then the facility has a renewed license.
Rule11: Either the facility applied for renewal, or the facility has automatic renewal.
Rule12: When the facility has automatic renewal, the facility has a license.
Rule13: Either the plant is shutdown, or the plant does not have contamination.
Rule14: Provided that maintenance is completed at the plant, the plant is not shutdown.
Rule15: Either maintenance is completed at the plant, or the plant has an operational upgrade.
Rule16: If the plant has an operational upgrade, then the plant is not shutdown.
Rule17: Under the condition that the facility meets standards, the facility has compliant operations.
Rule18: If the facility has an internal audit, then whenever the facility passed an audit, the facility meets standards.
Rule19: Should the facility have an external audit, then if the facility passed an audit, the facility meets standards.
Rule20: Under the condition that the facility has a scheduled audit, the facility has an internal audit.
Rule21: Provided that the facility has an unscheduled audit, the facility has an external audit.
Rule22: If the facility has a quarterly audit, then the facility has a scheduled audit.
Rule23: Either the facility has a quarterly audit, or the facility has an annual audit.
Rule24: When the facility has an annual audit, the facility has an unscheduled audit.
Rule25: Assuming the facility has expanded operations, the facility is operational.
Rule26: If the financial product has increased funding for the facility, then under the condition that the facility receives funding from the financial product, the facility has expanded operations.
Rule27: If the facility produces an approved drug, then the financial product does not have approval from the regulatory agency.

Rule28: Should the agency issue a formal warning to the facility, then under the condition that if the agency does not have regulatory oversight over the facility, then if it is not the case that the facility is compliant or the financial product has generic competition, the facility is operational, the agency does not impose fines on the facility.

Rule29: If the agency issues an informal warning to the facility, then provided that if the agency does not have regulatory oversight over the facility, then under the condition that it is not the case that the facility is compliant or the financial product has generic competition, the facility is operational, the agency does not impose fines on the facility.
Rule30: Assuming the agency conducts an initial review of the facility, the agency issues a formal warning to the facility.
Rule31: Either the agency conducts an initial review of the facility, or the agency conducts a follow-up review of the facility.
Rule32: When the agency conducts a follow-up review of the facility, the agency issues an informal warning to the facility.

Rule33: If the agency conducts a routine inspection of the facility, then under the condition that it is not the case that the facility is compliant or the financial product has generic competition, the facility is operational.
Rule34: If the agency issues a shutdown order for the facility, then the facility has a temporary closure.
Rule35: Should the agency issue a shutdown order for the facility, then the facility has a permanent closure.
Rule36: If the facility has a permanent closure, then the facility does not have a temporary closure.
Rule37: Provided that the plant passes inspection, then either the plant is operational or the plant does not have contamination.
Rule38: Whenever it is not the case that the facility is compliant or the financial product has generic competition, the facility receives funding from the financial product.
Rule39: If it is not the case that the facility is compliant or the financial product has generic competition, then the facility is not operational.

Rule40: Provided that it is not the case that if the financial product monitors compliance at the facility, then under the condition that the facility has an investment in the financial product, the facility produces an approved drug, then the facility passed an audit.

Rule41: If it is not the case that whenever the financial product monitors compliance at the facility, then provided that the facility has an investment in the financial product, the facility produces an approved drug, then the facility does not have compliant operations.
Rule42: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the facility has an investment in the financial product, then the facility produces an approved drug, the plant has contamination.

Rule43: Provided that it is not the case that if the facility has an investment in the financial product, then the financial product does not have approval from the regulatory agency, then the facility does not violate regulations.

Rule44: If it is not the case that if the agency has regulatory oversight over the facility, then under the condition that it is not the case that the facility is compliant or the financial product has generic competition, the facility is operational, then the agency imposes fines on the facility.

Rule45: Should it not be the case that if the agency conducts a scheduled inspection of the facility, then the agency conducts a routine inspection of the facility, then the agency conducts an emergency inspection of the facility.

Rule46: Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that if the agency conducts a scheduled inspection of the facility, then the agency conducts a routine inspection of the facility, then the agency does not conduct an emergency inspection of the facility, then the agency issues a shutdown order for the facility.
Rule47: Under the condition that the financial product does not have generic competition, the financial product has market demand.
Rule48: Should the financial product not have generic competition, then the financial product does not generate revenue.
facts: Fact1: The financial product monitors compliance at the facility.
Fact2: The financial product has increased funding for the facility.
Fact3: The agency has regulatory oversight over the facility.
Fact4: The agency conducts a scheduled inspection of the facility.
Fact6: The financial product is not profitable.
Fact7: The financial product is not sustainable.
Fact8: The facility is not compliant.
Fact9: The facility does not have a renewed license.
Fact10: The plant is not operational.

question: The financial product has generic competition.
